nodes.text: It's gonna cost ya 10 Lyra for the first question. After that, my price goes up. Answers don't grow on trees.
So put yer money down and ask away.
Now for yer next question, you'll need ta put 20 Lyra in the kitty.
Answers, we gots them. All it'll cost you is 40 Lyra.
Yeah, now we're talking real money here. Yer next question will take 60 Lyra.
This is where things gets interesting. It'll take 80 Lyra ta get yer answer.
If ya wants ta know something now, it's gonna cost ya plenty - 100 Lyra for an answer.
And now, boys and ghouls, it'll take 120 Lyra ta get an answer from me.
There's no way I'm paying you that much money to ask a question! Most of your answers are worthless!
Okay, okay, we can still make a deal here. From now on, all it will cost ya is 100 Lyra.
After all, I'm a reasonable guy.
Just put 100 Lyra in the till and ask away.
I guess I'll pay ${scene.questioncost} Lyra for an answer to my question.
I have a question for you...
But I'm a bit short of cash right now.
Come on, kid. You gotta keep better track of your funds. Go mug an old lady or something.
I'll find things out for myself.
Suit yerself, kid. But I gots answers to questions ya don't even have yet. Ya know where to come when you gets it.
No thanks.
Eh, whatever.
So, you're a ghost... and a fence... Why? What do you need money for?
Look kid, I always did my best ta be the best Fence there ever was, and I ain't gonna let death stop me.
Being dead has some advantages. I don't sleep. I don't eat. I don't need to worry about some dumb thief sneaking in here when I'm not watching.
And any jerk who tries to cross me will find out what its like ta be dead, too. Most guys take the hint.
How do you get your stuff down here? The Catacombs have been sealed off to the city. Do you get many customers?
Eh, business has been a mite slow lately, but the people what really needs my services know where ta go and how ta get here.
That memorial, what do you know about it?

Kinda figured you'd ask about that. Yeah, Shamus built that for his brother after Donal shuffled off to Buffalo. Bad time ta be a thief with the Raven missing and the united thieves' guild all falling apart.
I had a bet that Shamus would take over after Donal, but he seemed lost without his brother - and without the Raven. Hasn't been the same since...
What do you know about Donal O'Conner?
Ya know, Donal was the best Raven this place ever had. He was smart and fair. As long as ya didn't cross him, ya had it good. But Hades take ya if ya broke his rules. He had all sortsa rules.
What kind of rules?

The Raven didn't abide using a lot of violence ta steal stuff. Oh, a good cosh on the noggin ta knick a purse was fine, but throat-slitting was right out. Ya'd get kicked from the guild, banished, and sent off ta sea.

options.text: Ask for More Information on Donal

nodes.text: What else can you tell me about Donal?
Well, I knows that you are his little boy all grown up and following in his footsteps. That's why I let you into the memorial. Otherwise, it's invite-only.
Ya see, most people, they don't know that the last Raven went by the name a Donal O'Conner. There was a time that info was worth a fortune to the right ears, back when Donal was running stuff.
Now that the Raven is dead and gone, the only one who still cares about keeping that info secret is Mr. Chief Thief of the Con Games Guild, Shamus O'Conner.
What do you know about Shamus O'Conner?
I knows Shamus killed his brother...
At least, that's what the rumors say. All I knows for sure is that Shamus used ta be Donal's right-hand man as well as brother. They was close, real close.
But after Donal's death, Shamus never did find the Raven statue. So why did Donal hide it from his own flesh and blood?
Yeah, Shamus weren't half as smart or respected as Donal was. Just as well Shamus didn't get ta be the Raven. Things woulda turned nastier than they did when the Great Guild broke up in Donal's wake.
Murdering a kin is bad stuff by anyone's reckoning, and Shamus got blamed for Donal's death, guilty or not.
What do you know about Master von Urwald?
I could make a lot of Lyra if I had the goods on Gerhard. Word has it that Shamus has it in for Urwald. There's bad blood between them, far as I can tell.
So far, though, I got nada on Gerhard. Never laid eyes on the guy, far as I know. Rumors, yeah, I gots some of them. It's said that he was once Chief Thief in some podunk town up in Germania.
I even heard Gerhard had talked to the Raven before Donal died. There's talk that Gerhard took the Raven statue with him. A lot a people are looking for that statue, and their eyes are on Gerhard.
So, kid, if ya just happen to make the connections between Gerhard and the Raven, or if ya finds the Raven, I'll be willing ta pay you for the info. We can both get rich from it.
So do you know Joel Kyro? Do you do much business with him?
That little rat? I think he's setting himself up ta take my place! Yeah, he comes here all polite and nicey-nicey, but all he does is sell me junk and never buys a thing!

Sure, I'm a Fence. Buying is what I do, no questions asked. But it's the selling part where I makes money. So I figures the rat is either fencing or doing black-marketeering. Either way, it's bad for my business.
Do you happen to know what happened to Joel Kyro? He's missing.
Heh heh heh. The little rat was too nosy and got trapped by Zac. He don't gots much longer ta live. Zac'll drain him good. Ya don't wanna mess with Wraiths, kid. They are as bad as they get.
Zac's tomb is northwest in the Loco Periculoso section. Stay away from there if ya don't want to end up like your little buddy.
So what did you think of Joel's rescue?
Good news, bad news. Zac was nasty-bad. No ghost dared cross him. Worse, he scared people away from the Catacombs. So it was probably good riddance.
On the other hand, Zac didn't mind that I cleaned up his mess after he killed his victims. I got a lot o' good stuff from that over the years. Stupid fools didn't know better than to face a Wraith.
Do you know what happened to Joel Kyro?
Ya mean after Zac drained him ta death? His bones got added ta Zac's collection. That Wraith has got quite a pile of 'em now. As for the rat's stuff, let's just say I gots more stuff ta sell.
I'd sell ya the rat's clothes, but they'd be small on you.
What can you tell me about Wraiths?

Wraiths ain't ta be messed with. They got magic out the wazoo. They suck the life from the living just by being close. Normal weapons can't touch 'em. So unless ya gots all the magic money can buy, ya don't stand a chance.
And then, even if ya got the magic and the skill ta take the Wraith down, his magic stays around and he'll just be up again in another day or so. Ya gotta destroy his soul vessel, too.
And ta do that, ya gots to know where to look for the soul vessel. Wraiths don't exactly advertise where they had their soul and it's nowhere near where they manifest.

Then, ta destroy the vessel, it takes a special magic weapon to pierce the protections. And once that magic is broken, then all Hades breaks loose, too. If the Wraith is gonna be destroyed, he's gonna take ya with him.
So don't even think a taking on a Wraith. It's just not worth it.
Particularly not ta save the life of a worthless rat.
How do I destroy Zac Wraith?
Don't mess with him, kid. Zac scares ME, and I'm already dead. Mosta the spooks around here fears Zac. He can even suck the magic from other ghosts!
Then again, if ya does have the mojo and the magic and moxie ta pull off offing Zac, ya'd be doing us all a favor... Zac's nasty.

So if ya does want ta take Zac out, then ya better be protected by all the magic ya can get just ta counter the drains and the spells. Ya better have a major magic weapon and some major magic items ta use against Zac.

Once Zac is down, his form will dissipate and he'll be trapped in his Soul Vessel for a bit. Now Zac's Soul Vessel is hidden down in the southwest corner of the Locus Reflexionis in a small alcove on the wall.
It should be glowing... ya probably can't miss it. It'll take a Bone Sai ta break the magical barrier around the Soul Vessel. Then, it'll take magic ta break the phylactery and release Zac's soul.
Now, Zac won't go quietly. He's gonna try to take you with him. So ya better use some magical defense or you'll be joining us here.
I don't happen ta have a Bone Sai right now, but I knows where ta get one. Come back tomorrow afternoon and you can buy it from me for next ta nothing, as a favor from me.
It just so happens that I has a Bone Sai in stock right now that I'll be happy to sell to you...
Where is the Wraith's phylactery - and what is it?
You mean to say you put Zac back in his phylactery? Huh, who'd a thunk it?

Okay, so when ya defeats a boss Wraith like Zac, his spirit goes away to his Soul Vessel - a phylactery. He'll hide there until he recovers his energy. Takes a day or so, and then he's back terrorizing the Catacombs again.
Zac's phylactery is in the southwest corner of the Locus Reflexionis section. When he's there, it'll be glowing and hard to miss. You'll need magic to destroy it.
What sort of magic?
I know just the thing to take Zac out, but I'll have to get it. Come back tomorrow afternoon and you can buy it from me for next ta nothing, as a favor from me.
It just so happens that I has a Bone Sai in stock right now that I'll be happy to sell to you. It's the perfect weapon to destroy the phylactery and Zac.
Is there anything useful here in the Catacombs? Is there any treasure to be found here, or is it just a bunch of bones and ghosts?

What do you expect to find in the Catacombs - an Aegyptus tomb full o' gold? Sorry ta disappoint ya, kid. All ya find around here are a few burial offerings and prized possessions buried wit their owners.
Then again, there's some good stuff if ya knows where ta look. I just happen ta know exactly where all the bodies are buried and the valuables are stashed.
What kind of treasure can be found here - where do I look for some good stuff?
Ya asking a ghost about robbing graves for treasure?
Ya comes ta the right place! Yeah, I know where there's some good stuff stashed around here. Some are offerings, some are prized possessions.
For instance, there's a sweet magical ring still attached to the pinkie bone of some old dead guy in the Locus Reflexionis section to the southwest. It's in a burial alcove near Jarikith.
What other treasure can I find around here besides the one near Jarikith?

Most of the really good stuff left with the bones is long gone, sad to say. However, down in Cubiculum Luminari, there's a burial alcove near Refidnats that has a nice magical ring and some coins. Check out the bottom alcove.
I've already found that one.
So you did, kid. Well, how was I to know? It's not like I watch this place night and day.
What other treasure can I find around here?
Let me think... To the west in the Praetorium de Tenebris section, there's a skeleton with a magical necklace still wrapped around his neck bones. It's in an alcove just north of Raymond.
I've already found that one.
Really? Eh, guess I'll cross that off the list then.
Sorry, kid, but there's no refunds on questions. I gave ya the best answer I could give.

nodes.message: Put this here to make sure there is always an option when you ask a question - hopefully we can fill this with something entertaining?
Alternatively we could just add a lot more content to ask about Fester himself? Fill the game with a bit more random lore?

nodes.text: Are thieves the only patrons you get down here?
Nah, I gets all kinds down here - particularly politicians. All it takes is a little larceny in their soul and a whole lot of greed.
Do you ever actually use that chair?
Of course! I've got my feet propped up on it now. Can't you tell?
What's under that tarp?
What's it look like?
A bunch of crates.
There you go then!
But what's in the crates?
That's a whole 'nother question. You know the rules.
Okay, I've paid. What's in the crates under the tarp?
The crates are full of more tarps!
Who is that Librarian really?
Librarian? Never met him.
Not sure ya noticed, but I don't really leave the Catacombs. Might wanna keep your questions in this general area.
Do you know how to play Poobah?
Well I'm no pirate, but I've held a hand or two - back when I had hands. Lookin' for more players to liven up your game?
You know, on second thought, nevermind.

nodes.message: This needs a fallback case, or else it will be skipped.

nodes.text: So are you the guy to see about getting paid for the bounties in the next room?
Bounties? Hell no. That's the wall of honor. It takes a lotta gall to get a Wanted Poster. Those are some mighty fine folks, the lot of 'em. You ain't got what it takes to bring them in. No way.
Got any combat tips for the monsters around here?
Sure. I've got quite the handy incantation for undead.
First, you go back up to the Castle. Presumably the Great Hall or maybe the Hall of Heroes.
Then, you yell out the magic phrase as loudly as you can...
'LFM Pally Tank'!
